title: Crocodile's Weakness Theory - Why He Didn't Use Haki
theory: Fans theorize that Crocodile either didn't have Haki during the Alabasta arc or had become complacent after years of ruling Alabasta, losing his edge as a fighter. This would explain why he was defeated by a pre-Haki Luffy using only water as a counter to his Logia powers.
author: Various One Piece community members
evidence: Crocodile had become complacent ruling Alabasta
He later displays Haki at Marineford
Crocodile's character developed significantly between arcs
counterEvidence: Haki was not fully conceptualized in the story at this point
Crocodile was already a powerful Warlord

title: The Extent of Baroque Works Infiltration
theory: Fans have theorized about how deeply Baroque Works infiltrated both the royal army and rebel forces in Alabasta. The shooting of Koza in Episode 120 reveals that Baroque Works agents were embedded even in high-ranking positions within the royal army, suggesting Crocodile's network was far more extensive than initially shown. Some fans speculate that there may have been even more infiltrators who were never revealed.
author: One Piece community
evidence: Baroque Works agents successfully infiltrated both armies
They shot Koza from within royal army ranks in Episode 120
Multiple Billions agents were embedded as close officers to Koza
The infiltration was extensive enough to restart the war on command

title: Hero Water as Foreshadowing for Power-Ups
theory: Some fans theorize that Hero Water was an early introduction to the concept of temporary power enhancement at great cost, foreshadowing later power-up mechanics like the Rumble Ball, Monster Point, and even Gear techniques. The tragic deaths of the Tsumegeri Guards demonstrate that power gained through shortcuts often comes with devastating consequences.
author: One Piece community
evidence: Hero Water grants temporary superhuman strength but kills the user
Chopper's Rumble Ball has similar temporary enhancement effects
Monster Point originally had life-threatening side effects
Gear Second and Gear Third initially had drawbacks
The theme of sacrifice for power runs throughout One Piece
counterEvidence: Hero Water is never mentioned again after Alabasta
Most other power-ups are character-specific abilities, not external drugs
